channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Purple Heart Army veteran self-deports after nearly 50 years in the U.S.
item.description: Sae Joon Park left for South Korea on Monday. His removal order was the result of drug possession and bail jumping charges from over 15 years ago — of...

item.title: Israel and Iran's fragile ceasefire. And, what to know about NYC's mayoral race

item.title: Breaking another presidential norm, Trump drops the f-bomb on camera

item.title: Fired Justice Department lawyer accuses agency of planning to defy court orders
item.description: The accusations from a veteran government lawyer add to broader concern about the Trump administration's repeated clashes with the judiciary.

item.title: She hoped key research could help save her eyesight. Then the Trump funding cuts came

item.title: Colombian army frees 57 soldiers held captive by locals
item.description: Fifty-seven soldiers had been seized over the weekend and held captive in the restive Cauca region.

item.title: Brazilian tourist who fell off Indonesian volcano found dead
item.description: Juliana Marins survived the initial fall during an early morning hike along a trail on Mount Rinjani.

item.title: Baltimore's Reginald F. Lewis Museum celebrates Black History on Juneteenth
item.description: Baltimore's Reginald F. Lewis Museum celebrated its 20th anniversary and Juneteenth as part of this year's Day of Jubilee celebration.

item.title: Russian missile strikes kill 11 in Ukraine's Dnipropetrovsk region
item.description: President Zelensky said at least 160 more were injured, and warned the death toll may rise.

item.title: Germany vows to pay its 'fair share' on defence as Nato prepares for summit
item.description: The German chancellor says Nato leaders will aim to ensure peace in Europe for generations to come.

item.title: Venice protesters claim victory as Bezos changes wedding venue
item.description: No Space for Bezos activist group tells BBC they are "very proud of this".

item.title: 6 tax debt mistakes that could cost you thousands of dollars
item.description: Avoiding these common tax debt errors could save you serious money and prevent years of financial headaches.

item.title: Morgan State University archivist explains the significance of Juneteenth
item.description: June 19, 1865, can be described as a day of freedom. It's the day enslaved people in Galveston, Texas, learned they were free.

item.title: Track star from Newton also empowering young Black women
item.description: A student in Newton has taken the track and field world by storm while making waves in her community, all before she begins her junior year.

item.title: Man who opened fire outside a Michigan church had attended services there with his mom, pastor says
